review: I love this location super yummy! Staff is very helpful and food always taste fresh!  Love the Thai crunch and Santa Fe salad!  My boyfriend always gets the California club and avocado egg rolls (best ones I've had so far)

Ok, so I might not be a pizza expert, but if you want to have a real pizza that place is not for you. Pizza sizes are very small (almost a big snack) and maybe couple pieces of chicken. Thin crust ? Nahh, its extra thin with some salad and crunch on top. Thats not a pizza. So we had 2 small pizzas, beer and soda. = $50.  On a good side, pretty good staff and great cute place to relax or maybe to have a date.   P.S went to Chinese restaurant after, because we were still hungry lol

Came here before getting my shop on at the Bev Center. Food and service was great. We had Candace as our server who was extremely attentive and helpful. We shared the smoked salmon dish (forgot the exact name) between two people, pea soup, and mushroom spinach flatbread as our appetizer.  Despite them being really busy on a Saturday afternoon, service was prompt and food came out fairly quickly, our waitress also accommodated a last minute change in our menu selection so thank you for doing that!  Food was pretty good esp the appetizer--good stop for some lunch in between shopping as there aren't that many dining options without leaving the mall.  If I wasn't on a low carb diet I would definitely get some pasta bc they look amazing. Gotta love CPK! Remember to check yelp photos before ordering bc that can help you decide what to get-- that's what we did! Haha.

Time to get down-to-earth a little bit so my friend brought me to this pizza place which only have locations in California (as its name properly indicated). As neither of us was starving at that point (and both of us would like to save some space for dessert), we shared a half-size BBQ chicken salad (with avocado added) and the shrimp fettuccine. They both came in large size. Felt like once in a while I just need some junk food to boost up my energy! Would like to give a try on their handcrafted pizza next time! Thin crust oh yay!

These are pretty standard but our service was great, food came out right away and our Pepperoni Pizza was delicious. I ordered the Bloody Mary which was full of flavor and well worth the price. It isn't loaded with alcohol or anything, so it is fairly mild in that respect, but still good!

I was a little iffy about giving this place another try after getting sick from the Asian pasta.  This time, I got the garlic cream pasta, white sauce pizza & the chocolate cake with ice cream on top.   The pasta was a bit dry so it was hard to take in.  The white sauce pizza was not that good.  The choco cake was too dry so the ice cream helped, but it made the cake too soggy.   The girl who served us was awesome though.

Yes, I went to a chain on vacation but we hungry and tired on a Monday night and it was raining. Our waiter was a bit eccentric - maybe he wanted to be an actor - but that didn't really bother us. We all got three half salads and tea and it hit the spot. We were able to call and Uber right from our table (which was nice because of the rain) and ran out as soon as we saw him pull up to the curb.

2.5 stars. I have CPK once a year or so but always go with one of my stand by's, the BBQ chopped chicken salad. Curbside delivery at pretty much all of the CPKs make it easy to order by phone and pick up. But, my salad was just meh. It tasted a bit frozen. Not much life in it. The bread were tinier than my palm.  Order was ready when they said it would be. Portion size of the salad was the same as I remembered from the past. The quality was just so-so. Sort of disappointed. This location is connected to the Beverly Center so keep that in mind when dining in or picking up. It's busy.

very small cpk . Tried to order delivery to Cedars for lunch . The staff seemed incompetent was not confident that we would receive it ad first they left us on hold for over 5 minutes   & they didn't seem to grasp where we were at the hospital.  We waited till we were famished at dinner and this restaurant is NOT walking distance "right around the corner"  we ordered two salmon dinners which were edible. The flatbread pizza was a soggy wilted mess. The avocado egg rolls were also a soggy mess. Restaurants should wrap items that are crisp or line the packaging in paper to absorb the steam as this is what caused a soggy mess of food. The lids on the drink containers are too tight and once you try to shove the straw in it pinches the straw and you can get the soda through  the straw

Eric was the most attentive server we've had at ANY CPK in a long time.  He went out of his way to be friendly and checked on us a few times during the meal.  He even noticed my son was watching Frozen on our phone, and he shared some little known info about the movie that was fascinating.  It was a nice change to have a server who was genuinely friendly, (instead of going through the motions)  The food this day was REALLY good too.  Sadly, other CPKs food quality has taken a downhill turn, but this location on this lunch got it right.   Hubby and I shared a Waldorf salad (really refreshing and delicious!) and we helped our son finish his Kids Fusilli pasta with meat sauce.

I found this location to be better than the one I usually go to in Culver City. The Chopped Italian salad was very good as well as the Mushroom, Sausage and Pepperoni. Our server was very attentive for a party of 7. Overall a good experience.

This review is specifically on the service we had with Joshua. He's such a great waiter. He was very helpful and really funny.  The food here is good, they have a nice selection on wines :)  and the place is really clean. The hostess was sweet too, not sure what her name was.  It's located conveniently below the Beverly Center, you can park in the mall parking lot or on the street. After 9 or 10pm I believe they close the front entrance and you need to walk out from the back, so if you're coming for a later dinner I would suggest parking in the underground mall lot.

With a toddler and hot weather, CPK seemed like the best choice for a family friendly restaurant. Smallest CPK I have been to, but service was excellent. My friend and I can drink tons of diet coke, and he kept them flowing all throughout our meal. Had the chicken lettuce wraps which were delicious and they even provided us with extra lettuce when we ran out quicker than the chicken. My all time favorite pizza here is the Garlic Chicken, but they got rid of it. I asked the hostess if they had something similar, and she said no. I started perusing the menu and decided on a pizza but when I looked at the front cover, it had a sticker introducing the new and improved garlic chicken pizza. Odd that she didn't even know about it. It was slightly different but still friggin delicious. Their bread has also changed where it's not old stale slices of sourdough bread with butter on the side but hot out of the oven chunks of sourdough with the olive oil/vinegar dip. For dessert we had their famous butter cake with ice cream and the salted caramel pudding. The butter cake was AMAZING! We devoured the moist and warm butter cake (reminds me of pound cake) but with perfect crisp around the edges. The salted caramel pudding is good, but got way too much chunks of salt at the end. Main con of this restaurant is that parking at the Beverly Center is not validated.

No star!  Worst service ever!   I went to cpk today with my bf after christmas shopping. I was so happy before I came into this restaurant. We were sited table with light was not working because That's was only one table available to sit. Table was so dark but we didn't mind. After we received our food, we noticed that there is no plates and folks. I was looked for our server but he was too far away from us and we waited but he is not coming. I was stand up and go to front and at the middle I asked one of server to provide me the plates and folks so we can eat. Ok I understand maybe my server was too busy to come to our table but, he just keep passing us by and helping other tables except us. Server was Cameron. Because of you! I'll never go back to this restaurant. If you want to work as server, waiter you need to know what to do. Not just ask for tip.

Great food. Great service. Cool ambience. Good for groups! Jamaican jerk chicken pizza is my all time favorite! Tonight I came here for dinner with a couple friends, and we got super ultimate service! LIOR was our waiter. He is very sweet, down-to-earth, positive, patient, kind, and friendly. Probably one of the most important things in a business is its customer service, and I would have to say LIOR made tonight complete. Great Customer Service Skills!! THANK YOU LIOR!!

Pretty good CPK. Went on a Sunday afternoon and we did not have to wait at all for a table. Our waiter Daniel was spectacular. He catered to our every need. He exchanged a pasta I did not like for another. On the negative side it is a very small location. It is a little crowded but when not packed it is fine. Also they should get their front door fixed.

Awful service. I came for a late lunch and the girl who greeted me was very nice and showed me to the bar where I waited for 10 min.  Three guys behind the bar just talking and laughing. The guy next to me never got served and the girl who sat next to me didn't get served.  I guess that's the price u pay when you go to a place like Denny's

I have been to this particular CPK a bajillion times and it's been great! However, yesterday (7/10/15), I had a horrible waitress that ruined my lunch. I'm an avid tea drinker and order it most of the time when I'm eating out. As we sat down, I ordered the hot tea. Usually, they bring a small tea pot of hot water with a small plate that has honey, couple of lemon slices, and an UNOPENED tea bag. May I know why my waitress brought a single cup of tea with a tea bag that she took upon herself to open and dunked it. By the time she got to my table, my tea was PITCH BLACK and bitter. Who does that?! How do I know it wasn't someone else's tea?! Very sanitary. Also, I had to stir my drink with a fork as no spoons were brought over. Thanks?! We had ordered the cobb pizza and the wild mushroom. I asked for thin crust on both and received only one pizza with the thin crust. The pizzas were good but I wish we got what we had ordered. I let it go because we were with a child and I didn't want to wait any longer. Lastly, once we got our check, we paid with cash and the waitress just ASSUMED it was her tip in there as well so she never brought the change back. Once again, WHO DOES THAT?! We just got up and left. I was sick of her. I don't even remember her name, that's how annoyed I was at her. CPK please train your staff. It's important.

Can't really go wrong with CPK! A friend and I came in for dinner and it wasn't busy so we were seated quickly. Our server Josh was nothing but amazing! He was friendly, made jokes without being too "weird" or overly talkative like some servers tend to be, and was helpful with his recommendations. We ordered the Hawaiian BBQ pizza (scrumptious with the perfect amount of sauce) and the asparagus spaghettini (my favorite dish at cpk). We also ordered the strawberry lime margarita which was a little too strong for my taste but I'm just a little lightweight lol  Overalls, my experience here was great! Quick and friendly service with delicious food are always reasons to come back

My sever Lee would get a five star for service because she was very attentive.  Now for the rest... First it was SO COLD in the restaurant that I could barely sit there any longer than necessary. The fork had dried food stuck on it, gross.... And the hot sauce bottle was so gross with all the gooyeeee stuff on the top, it just made me wonder if the stuff I could see was this dirty what was going on with stuff I couldn't see?!?  Lastly the salmon really had a strong fishy taste to it which I've never experienced at any other CPK. Just not a good experience

This CPK definitely seems smaller than most. The guy at the front was very professional. We walked in and placed our name on the waitlist for a 20-25 minute wait, and came back 20 minutes later. It seemed like some people after us had been seated already, and the host at the front really hustled to get us a booth. The waitress that served us was also very attentive, and kept refilling my soda and asking us if we needed anything. We ordered the meat lovers pizza, the lettuce wraps, and a shrimp and chicken fettuccine. I highly recommend all of them! We had to take more than half the pizza home cos there was just so much food! If you stop in here for one thing, get the lettuce wraps!

Don't dine here! I was shopping in the area and wanted a bite to eat. I stopped in here during a relatively quiet hour and things still weren't good. I sat at the table for ten minutes before anyone came to take a drink order or just to say hi. I was about to leave, but I was hungry. The server finally came over, she was nice and all, but bad service.  The mediocre food finally came with a cocktail I ordered. The cocktail was awful; which she happily exchanged. The next one wasn't better.  I will not be back to this location, there are so many other restaurants in the area why settle for less than average?
I and my friends had Thai pizza, Chicken dumplings and Lettuce wraps for lunch after walking all around in Beverly Ctr for shopping. All these ethnic dishes were so good and a little bit spicy.

[how many word chinese and thai can you find in this review?] came to beverly center for shopping, and my friends and i came here for late, casual dinner.  we ordered shrimp lettuce wrap, thai pizza, and CHINESE chicken salad.   after lettuce wrap, the pizza and salad arrived.  my friends noticed the salad did not taste like chinese chicken salad.  honestly, i could not tell the difference.  call me ignorant asian, between thick brown sauce from the shrimp wrap to thick peanut sauce in the salad, i thought that's what "chinese salad" suppose to taste like at chain restaurant (can you tell chinese salad isn't my go-to when dining out?) my blond and brunette friends suspected perhaps they served thai salad by mistake.   i waved a host to come over (since i could not flag down the waiter) and asked if this is chinese or thai?  even he wasn't sure, but finally confirmed thai and will get our waiter.  [are you still following?] when the waiter came to our table, he already looked annoyed, didn't ask us if everything was fine, instead looked at us like, what's da problem?!? we mentioned we got the wrong salad to which he said, YOU ordered thai salad. i wrote it here that you did!  we went back and forth a bit, we mentioned perhaps there was miscommunication because we ordered thai pizza also.  however, his overall attitude was defensive and annoyed as if we are causing a problem/scene.  he kept saying, you said thai, i heard you said thai and wrote it here, look!  THAI salad!  *pointing at his scribble* honestly, mister waiter?  you wrote thai perhaps YOU thought we said thai.  why would we lie to you?  we are professional women who simply brought it up to your attention that we got the wrong dish. the way he handled it was very impolite and borderline rude.  i understand the demographic who dines here is under twenty-five, but a little graceful and hospitality go a long way.  at the end he asked, so, what do you want to do?  (by the way, the thai is better, chinese -  another thick brown sauce)  we would have been fine with leaving it as is, but because of his attitude, i told him to replace it.  when he brought the correct salad, we even joked with him to ease our awkward encounter - whatta work!  so much for casual dinner. . . my friend asked how much should we tip?  i said, definitely not 20%.  granted our bill was under $60 which didn't make much of  difference, at the end he got a few dollars less.  however this review is for CPK corporate to please train your staff to handle conflicts with diners professionally.  the mister waiter trying to prove that he was right (which he wasn't) is not worth the battle.  who knows when i'll return to CPK, but it would have been nice to walk away feeling, i've missed out on a good casual place for all these years, instead of whatta jerk!  was it necessary to be all pissy? - Skip This Place.
Great food, Terrible service.  What a disappointment, the waitress and manager were so rude and ignored us. Never coming to this CPK again!!

I've been coming here for years. Food is always great and consistent. My faves include chicken tortilla soup, thai crunch salad, and pesto cream penne. I've never had a problem with the service and also their take out. The staff is great and friendly and I always enjoy coming here.

I would like to start off saying that pizza is not typically my favorite kind of food, so I am a little bias here. First time coming here, I wanted to take my mon and grandma (came from Taiwan) to taste some american style food. Service is always great here! However, the pastas seem to be a little dry. I ordered two pasta dishes and they were both kind of dry. Perhaps a little more creaminess would really make the dish phenomenal. Second time coming here was with a friend, we had pizza, wine, and I ordered another pasta, it was much much better than the first time I ordered. Wine was great and service continues to be very professional.

Well, lunch and wine are always good. Lunch and wine ending with evacuation = not so good. Free lunch and wine = excellent!  CPK serves decent food, even if it isn't my first choice here in LA.   Yup, my girl friends and I were there on that Sunday in March when a bomb scare shut down the entire Beverly Center.  Luckily, we managed to enjoy our lunch and conversation before all the craziness started.  We started with an app of the Tuscan Hummus with whole wheat pita.  Not bad!  I liked that they give you plenty of pita, so you probably won't have to ask for more.  Since the other girls were indulging, I also ordered one of the new Adventurous wine flights, which had two reds (can't remember which) and a Moscato.  I like variety, so the flight is a fun way to try a few sips of multiple wines.  For my entree, I had the Waldorf Chicken salad: grapes, green apples, candied walnuts, crisp celery, field greens, and Gorgonzola tossed with housemade Dijon balsamic vinaigrette.  It was fairly generous and fresh, but I really wanted more flavor.  I kept adding salt and pepper.  And just as we all finished our meal... the manager came over to tell us that we had to leave.  No, not just us, everyone.  The building was being evacuated.  And that was our meal.   On a funny note, I found a kindred spirit in my friend Emily, when we both confessed that the idea of standing there and chugging our wine before leaving had crossed our minds.  Oh well.

I love CPK and all of the locations are pretty consistent, but this on at the Beverly cnter is always a it of a mess.  I understand that the entry is very limited with seating space, but instead of telling guests who are waiting to "head to the bar to grab a drink and wait for their table," the host just told everyone to "wait in the doorway" which was pretty awkward with 3 separate parties just standing on the street.  We had about 3 servers during the duration of our dinner and had to place our order 2 different times. I know they were busy Sunday night, but very disorganized.  The food was great - it always is.  The host then got bored and just hovered over our table to chat with us. really awkward.

I've eaten at California pizza kitchen before and it was great. I would now start to believe that the quality and the food has decreased so bad to were I would compare them to Mc Donald's. It's almost like they are the new pasta/pizza fast food. The cheese noodles were really not good at all. I've had them a few times before and this time it was just not good at all. I payed more then 50$ for two people which was really not worth it.

Terrible service!  Not even a Hi.  6-7 employees was huddle up toward the back of the store laughing, giggling, etc.  then the server came to assist the table next to me.  Since that table didn't need assisting, we figure we're next!  (Joke on me). Another 4-5 mins went by before they took our drink order (water and two cokes). Total wait time for drink was 18-20 mins!

JP or was it PJ? was our server and he was very attentive even though it was lunch time and very busy. He has good knowledge of all food items and the side he recommended was great. If you are adventurous on your pizza and you want good ambience, this is the place. Parking is not validated but only $1 per hour.

I had never been to a cpk before and was surprised of how good it was. Food was a bit over my budget $15 per plate, but it was good. Very clean, hostess was nice, took us right away. No waiting whch is a plus. Our servers name was Eddie and he did a great job aswell.
Terrible service. It took 25 minutes for just one flatbread and the waitress got my order wrong.
Came to this location a few weeks ago with my mom. Ordered the barbecue chicken and mushroom flatbread. The food is always fresh and made to order. Great service and always busy. Thanks cpk!

I haven't been dining out because of my diet, but it was Doctor's orders and a family came saving me from the deliciousness of life. I have lost already 45 pounds since January 1st and I deserved a little treat for the hard work. However, you are thinking that I got a pizza....Let's see what I got at CPK at the Beverly Center. CPK is located on the La Cienega side on the street level. Not inside the mall. The family and I walked in and this CPK seems to be very small. There were only 5-6 booths and the tables seem to be too close to each other. You literally touch the next table with your elbow without noticing. I had to hear a bunch of conversation with other couples that I felt uncomfortable listening to, especially when there is a child in my group I don't remember who our server's name was, but he was extremely helpful with the menu. The child of the family ordered right off before I opened my menu. Kid loves the Hawaiian Pizza, but didn't like the coloring book that CPK gave...lol. I think it was $5.99 for the pizza, but I am not sure since I didn't pay for the meal. Our server mentioned that they have a new menu called "Small Cravings" for those watching out their weight. So, I took advantage of it. I ordered the Mediterranean Plate ($4.29) and Tuscan Panzanella Salad ($5.49). The prices are estimate since it was quite low when I saw it. The Mediterranean Plate is basically hummus, pizza pita bread with a Mediterranean salad mix (Cucumbers, onions, and Greek Olives). I blame a certain friend for getting me hooked to hummus, which I have never had, but so addicted to it. The Tuscan Panzanella Salad was quite sweet, but I love the beans and the sauce which I am not familiar with, but made the salad taste good.  I don't have the total since I didn't pay, but I think I saw it was $30 something and the family had a 20% off coupon that you have to use 7 days after visit.  So, it would be around $25 and the discount would go to the tip. Service was great, but it was the crowding I had a problem with. Grand Lux Cafe has a bigger room and they probably stole a lot of real estate from them. So, did you guess what I got correctly? Probably not. You thought I would get pizza. Not for a long while. With me 45 pounds down, I still got a long way to go to 240 and time to flex my muscles once again. Eating healthy has a good price and it will sure have a return on investment.  The Yelp Universe. Where are you traveling today?

haven't been to this cpk at the bev center in forever.  they did some kind of re-design, but it's looks like pretty much the same color scheme and themes as before (woods, beiges, sticky table tops and menus etc..) and made changes to the menu too.  i could swear the bread used to be much better.  little bite sized pieces of a variety of breads, not just white bread... but maybe i'm drunk and imagining this!  menu has changed too so if you're looking for your old favorites you best keep on looking.  (my fave, a pizza with shrimp, has disappeared from the menu!) service was lovely... very nice waitress from bulgaria.  looked mila kuna'ish.  food was tasty.  i just had the pizza with everything on it, the works. i definitely very much like the food here..... i just think i like the old menu better!  this is something i would like to eat every day but running about at $15+ per pop, i can't eat it every day! but when i'm hungry, wanna get fat, wanna treat myself -- this is definitely a tasty place for me. (just read another review here that is disturbing.... do they really brush high fructose corn syrup on the pizza?  before i eat here next time i will definitely ask....)

The best part of our experience in visiting the California Pizza Kitchen, was that the hostess, the waitress (Emily) and the manager were extremely friendly and helpful. The food and the environment were just ok.

Usually go to the Beverly Hills location but was close by and decided to grab dinner with my girl friend . Got seated right away it was 9:24 pm got taken to the table and got handed menus and was told the server would be with me ,it was 12 minutes until the server finally came to our table (the table smelled like humid towel not like fresh sanitizer ) . We ordered 2 strawberry lemonades and got what I'm sure was fountain lemonade with strawberry syrup, what happen to the freshness?  .For dinner my gf had a pizza with olives and pineapple, and I had the original bbq chicken pizza which is one of my favorites but it was missing something that night. In my opinion CPK has gone down in customer service significantly and they need to get back on there game . Only reason I give two stars is because food was edible and the server refilled our drinks. Hope to have a better experience next time . Definitely not at this location though.

Oh my god, I'm in love with this place! I came here last week with my wife and we had such a good time. Let me start by saying that I never got such great service like a got from our server Lior. We didn't know what to get and Lior recommended that we try the cedar plank salmon. It was so delicious and juicy! Besides the food, Lior was attentive, gave us such great service and was so funny and personable. We will definitely be back for more!

We were sitted and the waiter didn't come for good 10 minutes until we finally found one and asked him to bring us our waiter. Even then it took good 5 minutes before our waiter showed up. We asked for bread and it never came. Asked again and still never came. The food took really long time to come out and just poor service generally. We waited about 30 mins for the food and when we asked I'm pretty sure they forgot our order so they brought us some chips with barely any guacamole as service for forgetting our order I suppose. We had to wait even longer for the food to come out. Service is pretty poor here. They didn't apologize once. If you're wanting to go to cpk find another location. Update: the manager finally came when we kept bugging about our food and they admitted that they forgot our order. Finally apologized and said that the drinks were on the house. FYI we waited for over 45 mins for the food to come out. You guys decide. Is 45 minutes worth the drinks? Cause I would rather pay for the drinks and get my food in 15 minutes.  I probably won't be coming back here again.
I was there for Super Bowl and set at the bar.  The food was good and the service was excellent.  The bartender was very bubbly and attentive!  Love this place!

The food is good but if you are ordering to take out you had better check everything because they will probably get the order wrong. in the last 4 months I got 3 orders completely wrong. I ordered split pee soup but what I got was tortilla soup which was auful and went right down the drain.I ordered Penne pasta, but I got spaghetti which I have a hard time eating. I went into the store and ordered face to face so you'd think they could get the order right? Nope! I started checking every item, opening up the pizza box, etc, but that's a drag and this last time I went into the store and spoke to the order taker directly. So, buyer beware! You'd better check every detail of your order, including the bread, because they have a really hard time getting it right.  Hungry in L.A.

Love the quinoa arugula salad, margherita pizza, spinach artichoke dip, and the Kung pao spaghetti, and lettuce chicken wraps.... Yummmm!!  Last night we received the wrong order for take out--- the manager made it up to us tonight and offered a refund for the incorrect items that were given to us!! Pretty awesome customer service.  Love CPK!!

I have been here several times throughout the years. I can honestly say I've never been disappointed. I went tonight and had the Thai Crunch Salad, which was great. I love the dressing they put on the salad. I admit we sat without drink refills for awhile and that was disappointing, however our server was very nice and it wasn't his fault. His other table kept him forever to ask sooo many questions. There were other employees standing around talking. So to finish off my review they should work on teamwork to improve their service. There is nothing wrong with helping out a fellow co worker. :)

My family is a huge fan of CPK, it's kinda scary when they know everyones name in your party. Me-not so much. Still, every year I get a CPK gift card from one of my uncles and have to do something with it. The portions are huge. It had been a few years since I ate here so I forgot how much food each entree and pizza are. How bout just a slice of pie, maybe 2? Nope. Last visit we were a party of 2 and we ordered too much, there was barely enough room for the food and plates to sit on our two top.  2 HUGE flat bread pizzas...gorge! Pear and Gorgonzola  - I liked this pie, it's different-it's like salad meets pie. Caramelized pears add a little bit of sweetness, gorgonzola cheese was crumbly and has a salty bite and walnuts were a nice crunchy surprise! Spinach and Artichoke   pie is a nice concept, but gets soggy, fast.  Ingredients are not skimpy by any means, there was plenty on both pies.  Peach lemonade   was tasty, but just a tad heavy on the syrup for my taste. After a few sips I gave up on it and went for a cold brew, goes better with pie anyway. Our server was so nice, upbeat and suggested items on menu. We had a nice dining experience, resturant was tidey, but Im not hooked on their food, I'm just not a CPK fan. Delivery is available and this CPK delivers by bike. In the heart of Beverly Grove pedaling is faster, most of the time, than driving and looking for parking. Update: Had to change my original 3 stars to a 4 star because service was stellar, prices are more than fair considering portions, hot food hot and cold beer cold!

So, I have mix feeling about this place. First of, we got there early when it wasn't busy. Our server is really attentive and he does come in and check up on us from  time to time. We order the Jambalaya Pasta and the Hawaiian Pizza (thin crust). The pizza is delicious, the outside bread is crispy and the inside is chewy. The ham is thick and the sweet pineapple made a perfect touch on that pizza. Right away, I felt in love with the dish. However, the Jambalaya pasta is a different story. The noodle is under-cook and still hard to chew. I'm 35 years old and my mouth was getting tire from chewing. I don't know if any of you have ever put so much chili on a dish that it no longer taste spicy but you get that strong bitter taste instead? Well, this is what happen with the pasta, the cook put extremely a lot of spices that made it taste so bitter. Took the pasta home and after putting all the effort of re-cooking that dish, it still has that strong spice flavor that it won't go away. I ended up trowing that dish to the trash. What a waste of money.

Been to one CPK been to them all. CPK is reliable and tasty. Every time I go I get either the BBQ chicken pizza or the BBQ chicken salad. This time I got the BBQ chicken salad it was so good I ate it before remembering to take a picture. Lol next time. Good price and the right mix of flavor. Comes with beans and corn in it as well. Make sure to give it a try w/ a strawberry lemonade, you will love it.

This was my first restaurant stop on my visit to LA and chose it to be the last one prior to heading back home. In a little over five days I visited the location three times and overall I'm very happy with the experiences. I had a few different dishes throughout the visits and each was equally good, with the least favourite being the hand tossed pizza (the breaded chicken with arugula takes the top spot for me, followed by the crunchy thin crust marguerita pizza).  Desserts were also good and decent sized. What made this place stand out though was the great service provided by the waiters and the hosts. Not only were they very efficient but they also seemed to have a genuine interest in my satisfaction (either that or they'll be really good actors one day!). :D I'll definitely come back to visit in future trips. Not sure about other locations but this one was definitely worth the time spent here.
Disgusting salad with fat congealed on cold bacon. Service was excellent but sadly never again.

Terrible terrible terrible costumer service!!!!!!!  The "greeter" was very rude he wasn't doing his simple job as a greeter. He walked away and left us standing and he didn't say a word afterwards he left menus on the table so i assumed they were for my husband and I. Our waiter was also very rude and didnt even go once to ask how were we doing and Never showed up with the napkins we asked for:( very disappointed!!!!!

Our food here came quickly and our server was really nice.  She helped me choose which sangria i wanted to try,  which turned out to be really tasty! We had the Margherita Pizza on thin crust,  which was exactly what i had been craving,  since moving out here from the east coast.  It is so hard to find thin crust out here,  which is normal to me for pizza to have.  We had a really nice time and are glad we made this pit stop for dinner when seeing a local show.
Horrible customer service & I'm not the type to ever write reviews unless they have really upset me!! If I could choose no stars I would.

Service - the server was really nice. Busy dinner time. Still manage to bring us refills before we finish the drink.  Food - came out a little too fast. I ordered the shrimp pesto penne. The penne is way too undercooked. Shrimp was cooked. My mom ordered the same but with fettuccine, and well the pasta was way undercooked. My sister ordered the grill veggies with chicken. Now, her veggies is burnt and the chicken was way too over cooked. My gf ordered the Hawaiian pizza and it was ok. We were too hungry to complain and wait for another one. Mehh. Shouldve went to andrea's by kmart for pasta.

Terrible service , waited for 10 mins then another 10 to get water . She served my soup with my pizza. When I asked for the soup as an appetizer.  She charged for 2 glasses of wine when I only ordered 1. Never coming back .

Good is always good at CPK. Today, the service SUCKED though. Our server was fine, she was sweet. The manager was the problem. Got super shorted on my chicken in the pasta and he came to try and explain how "it's in there" and offered to bring me a side. Then the jerk charges me for it (never once mentioned it) and forbid the server from taking it off my bill. I don't mind paying for extra, but this wasn't extra. I had to dig through pasta to find chicken crumbs. He was supposed to be making it up for the crappy portion but he used it as an oportunity to be a jerk. F him!

The service here is always great.  The manager served us himself and kept checking in on us, which I really appreciated. Interior is clean, even the bathrooms. The portion sizes are pretty big (good enough for 2 people, I'd say). I'd recommend the caesar pizza (the name escapes me, but it's like a salad on a pizza) and the Chicken Tequila Fettucine. Parking is convenient too because the Beverly Center lot exits right in front of the restaurant.

Out of all of the CPK's I have been to, this one has by far the best service. The staff here is very patient, friendly and attentive even though they seem to be busy all the time. They are located in the Beverly Center building so the few times that I have been here, they don't ever seem to have a down time. However, there are always a couple of tables open and with just a party of 2, it is very easy to be seated quickly. It is also a convenient location so that after eating a filling lunch/dinner, you can walk it off at the Beverly Center or at the plaza across the street.  The food here is the same as at any other CPK. Some dishes are pretty good and some are okay. I used to like the sandwiches here, but ever since they changed the bread to ciabatta bread, which isn't really my favorite kind of bread, it no longer tastes the same. However, their tortilla soup is delicious! It's a bit sweet and tasty. My boyfriend really likes their four cheese ravioli which is tasty as well and comes with your choice of mushrooms. The only downside is that it takes a longer while for your entrees to come out. When you are starving, you don't want to wait more than 10 minutes for your food. Other than that, my experiences here has always been pleasant and satisfactory.

Took my husband here for Father's Day. We come here often and usually have a great time. The food is always good and the servers are usually amazing. I said usually. Unfortunately all of those amazing servers were off on Father's Day. Our sever told us repeatedly that he was new and even asked us if the kitchen had capers(which I added to a pasta). It's on the menu, dude. Come on. I have a high tolerance for bad service since I manage a restaurant for a living, but this wasn't just bad service. This guy must have been high out of his mind. A complete mess. Worst of all, the manager on duty spent our entire visit hanging out with the hostess. Here's a tip for ya, if you're gonna throw the new guy on the floor, check on his tables once in a while, will ya.

After shopping at Beverly center CPK seemed like a great place to get my grub on.  The food was great and very filling. My grandparents who are visiting LA from Mongolia really enjoyed it. The service was good as well.  I will definitely come back!

A couple of weeks ago my family and I went to CPK for a nice meal. The service was terrible. We had to ask multiple times for items they forgot to serve, and then had to wait at least ten minutes for drink refills, and almost 15 minutes for 4 children's sundaes. In trying to make up for the terrible experience they gave us a coupon for a free entree. So yesterday I went back in with my wife and son. I told them I had a coupon and the manager came over and said I'm sorry you had a bad experience last time we will take great care of you today.  Well that was a huge lie.  We asked for bread 3 times!! It took nearly 15 minutes to get that. They brought out food for my wife and I , however it took 7-10 more minutes before they brought out my sons pizza. The food was sub par and I had to call the manager over again, wondering why he didn't come and check on us knowing that we had a poor experience previously. We will NeVER go back again

I have to admit that I love California Pizza Kitchen!  It is one of those places that my family and I can go to and no one will complain.  Everyone is always able to find something on the menu that they want to eat, which typically makes for a happy family meal.  After all, everyone loves pizza, and CPK has some really great tasting pizzas. We recently got to try this specific CPK for the first time, and it was a pretty good experience.  It can be a bit of a challenge to find as it is tucked into the bottom floor of the maze known as the Beverly Center.  It is also quite small, but still had everything that we have come to expect from CPK.  The service was good too, but they did seem a bit under staffed.  I order the Thai Chicken Pizza, which is my favorite CPK pizza.  It tasted exactly the same as it does at all of the other CPKs, and I love knowing exactly what I am going to get when ordering something because of CPK's consistency.  My pizza was delicious as usual and exactly what I would expect from CPK. This is a smaller, more casual CPK.  It offers the same feeling, taste, and experience as other CPKs...just on a smaller scale.  It is a great place to go for lunch or to have a casual sit down meal with friends or family.

A standard CPK, right next to the Beverly Center (although I don't think any direct access from the Mall).  CPK as a chain normally gets 3 stars, but our server was very attentive and my iced tea was never empty (had to actually ask him not to fill it up the last time).   Spinach artichoke dip was ok, obviously not made fresh or from scratch, but still gooey and yummy.  My Sicilian pizza (what I always get) was a bit soggy, but not too bad.

After going to the Beverly Centre for shopping, my gf said we should go to CPK which was part of the complex. She has been a fan of CPK for some time apparently, so my expectations were somewhat built up before we started. The pizza tasted great, as it probably should, considering that it is slightly more expensive. The service was nothing special. I can't really give more than 3 stars because it wasn't really memorable, and probably not that different from what you would expect at other CPKs. Having said that, I would probably go back if I have the chance.

I usually come here to take my FAVVVV salad ever - BBQ Chicken+Avocado Chopped Salad so last Sunday was the 1st time 2 of us came here for sit-down dinner last Sunday. We had the spinach+artichoke dip w tortilla chips to start, then came the full size of my favvv salad and Hawaiian Chicken pizza. For dessert, had the warmed butter cake w huge scoop of vanilla ice cream - delicious. Service was very good too and place was bustling as it always seems to be whenever I've been in! As the dinner was part of their 5 day Valentine's special, total bill incl tax was only $35.

My family enjoys this location. The food at this location is better than other CPKs I've been to.My only complaint would be that it isn't the best spot to bring a date for an earlier dinner. It is very loud and seems like this place has turned into a Chucky Cheeses for families in the neighborhood. I have a kid so it doesn't bother me much, but I could see how others would get annoyed with noise level and all the little kids running around.

I have never been impressed by this corporate restaurant chain.  I go back because it's everywhere and seemingly convenient.  We went tonight after I got off work and the sub par guest experience began just after the door opened.  We waited awhile to be greeted.  We were quickly pushed into a small table for two.  We waited upwards of ten minutes to be greeted even though we were one of five tables in the restaurant an hour prior to closing.   The waiter didn't introduce himself; he just said "drinks?"  We then waited an additional five to ten minutes and he came back and took the same drink order that he forgot.  We were then brought our sodas and we ordered an appetizer and asked for a few minutes to decide on what we wanted for entrees.   The waiter moved into a squat position and refused to leave till we decided and stated that it was cpk.  The food is "whatever."  The server eventually brought our food.  He never checked in.  Finally the restaurant has closed.  The music was off.  The lights raised.   There were still the same five tables awaiting service.  We were finally presented with a bill.  I showed him my rewards number and asked to use my dessert reward for my birthday and he told us the person who makes the desserts had gone home.  I asked what I should do considering it was about to expire and he didn't offer anything.  It was a terrible experience.   The manager was sitting at the table over from us typing Away on his computer the whole time.   Poor service.  I would rather go to chilis.  At least it is priced accordingly.

What the hell happened to this place? Did the management change? I used to come here all the time after shopping and always left with satisfied belly. Unfortunately, not this time. I always thought you can't go wrong with pastas, but apparently, they proved me wrong. Fettuccini and spaghetti were hard like plastics. Pasta was lacking sauces where you taste just plain noodles. We explained to the waitor, but he neglected to do anything about it. Then, he came over to ask if everything was okay. He had to be joking. I recommend, head over to Grand Luxe or PF Chang next door where you will get better food and service. This location CPK is unique one you want to avoid.
Small dining area but fast service. Very friendly service. Food is great.  Very kids friendly. Great for families.  Be sure to get the key lime pie.

So it's not gourmet, but CPK has some yum yum food for a food chain.   Love their moroccan chicken salad - delicious!  I order this almost every time, whether it's take out or dining in I can't help it.  Fresh ingredients with fresh romaine lettuce, roasted beets, butternut squash, chopped avocado and dates with macadamia nuts with a champagne dressing, seriously what's not to love?   Pasta's are decent, I can't complain.  I eat it. Pizzas are yummy.  The fact that I can grab it from von, ralphs or target and put it in the oven for 10 minutes and viola CPK in my home tells me that this franchise can make decent wood over pizza.  Maybe not the best in the whole wide world, but pretty decent for a quick meal. Service has always been good, nothing spectacular, but come on it's not some michelin star restaurant so you can't expect very much.  Always refilled my drinks, checked on us in a timely manner and brought the food out piping hot or in my case cold.

A friend and I went in tonight and had one of the BEST experiences. There was a very minor mishap in communication, and in response the manager (a brown haired man) and the server ( a blonde woman) went out of their way to take care of us. They even ended up paying for the meal on the house. The food was ridiculously good, and the people were even better. :)

The food is like any other CPK so I don't think that needs reviewing. What I wanted to rave about is the take-out service. It's always so good! Especially yesterday, the guy that took my order and brought out my food was hustling! I told him he didn't need to hurry so much that I was cool on waiting but he was super polite and made sure I got my order quickly. Which is why I tipped him kindly. I used to work at a restaurant and also in to-go so I was very appreciative of his service. Only downside to to-go orders is that where you park is where Valet is. They will give you some serious attitude even though you're SUPPOSED to park there. Beverly Hills jerks!

The fried mac is gross. Im glad it's only on the experimental menu because its not very flavorful and had some sort of aftertaste. The miso salad is no longer on the menu, however the Thai crunch was tasty. Service was good, especially take out.
Love this place and the manager Ivan is really amazing! Go there pretty often and keep coming back :)

There's something unsettling about paying for sub-par service. Chris, does an awesome job of ignoring and forgetting you, until he sees you yelping him with a 1 star rating. The food was okay, but it was quickly overshadowed by the terrible customer service. I will not be returning to this location nor do I recommend it!
Delicious pizza, lettuce wraps, and salads- very slow service.

What can I say about CPK that hasn't been said before?  Hmmm...nothing except that everything that I've ordered there has been consistently good.  I think they have one of best Tortilla soup I've ever had.  The hubby loves the kung pao spaghetti.   I know it's called California PIZZA Kitchen but I rarely order pizza.  The times that I did, I wasn't disappointed.  I'd pick their pizza over Mozza's.
Just an FYI, was asked to send my bad review to cpk's email so they could "make it right", I did. It's been way over a week and no one was even responded to make it right. Thanks again CPK!
Great place to have a causal lunch date or dinner date. The service is good and the food is good as well. Love the spinach artichoke dip, my fav! Don't have to wait to be seated. That's a plus!

Grayson F hooked me up with the CPK scoop - they have some vegan options... He sent me a link to the official CPK list of vegetarian, vegan and gluten free items served at their restaurants.  Check it out:   Thank you Grayson - thanks buddy! I had the vegetarian pizza with japanese eggplant - minus the cheese and it was fantastic.  As you all know, I am not a fan of fake cheese, so this pizza with its tasty sauce and veggies along with its crispy neopolitan crust suited me perfectly. Being able to eat at a chain restaurant is a privilege that most folks take for granted.   Sometimes a chain restaurant is the only option so I'm glad that I can now count on CPK. Seriously vegans, try this pizza and some of the other vegan items on their menu.
$13.50 for spaghetti bolognese. Bland, not enough sauce to cover the noodles, and I paid to add mushrooms that were not included in the order. Stick with the pizzas, I guess

For a long time I've had a dim view of the food quality at CPK, but recently a friend told me that I had to stop by and try the Brussels sprout-bacon-goat cheese pizza that they are running as a seasonal special. I did, and it's great! I've been back three times in as many weeks. And they do seem to have upped their game across the board. We've also had  their chile relleno and a small-plate arugula salad. Both were excellent.

What can you say... it's CPK... a chain.  Most chains are pretty much the same. This one is in the Beverly Center.  The parking at Beverly Center is actually REALLY cheap.  $2 for 4 hours?  I'll take that. We walked in TEN minutes before closing but they still took us.  We sat down in a booth and browsed the menu.  A server came by saying that our supposed server was at the moment MIA, so she took our drink orders. She came back a few minutes later, saying that our supposed waitress was still MIA and that she was going to just serve us.  I like that initiative in someone.  She was cute too.  No, I did not ask her for her number. I decided to get the meat lover's pizza (forget exactly what it was called) and a small Thai crunch salad.  The pizza wasn't too bad.  It had pepperoni, salami, Canadian bacon, and Italian sausage on it.  I actually really like the Thai crunch salad.  I get it almost every time.  There's probably as much "stuff" in there, if not more, than there is actual lettuce, but I still like it.  It's got chicken, crispy rice noodles, peanuts, edamame, carrots, red cabbage, green onions, crispy wonton strips, and uh... yeah, it's a lot of stuff.  You can also add avocado for an additional charge.  It's not healthy by any means I'm sure, but I like it. Service was on par.  Never did she seem like in a rush because it was past closing time and our waters were never empty.  That's always a plus

I mean ... I hear all the rave about California Pizza Kitchen it's even referred to by acronym (C.P.K.) but, it just didn't live up to the hype.  Before finally trying out the restaurant, I used to buy the frozen version of their pizza which I thought was quite decent.  The frozen version is definitely thinner, which, surprisingly is not as thin dining in.  Kinda confusing.   Appetizer/Starter - So, I wasn't trying to each much so I ordered the "chicken quesadilla".  I commend them for finding the worlds smallest tortilla to use on a quesadilla.  Unbelievable, I mean, I get it, it's $4.99 they cut it into 4 equal pieces, but the portion is so small each piece is bite size.  Eh, I mean it tasted semi decent, but for $4.99 NOT worth it.   Pizza - My homie ordered the BBQ chicken pizza.  I tried a slice, it was OK. Not worth the $13 you spend on a personal size pizza.  Ridiculous. Whole foods pizza is better. Service - It wasn't great, but what can I expect in 2010???  In my opinion, servers nowadays seem to just "EXPECT" a tip without attempts at earning it.  I can't blame them though, it's also the patrons who just "automatically" tip (no matter if the service was amazing or terrible) who enable servers to behave this way. Oh well.  I drink lots of water.  Our waiter picked up my plate after I finished my bite size quesadilla.  My empty glass was just sitting there, on the table as he picked up my empty plate.  5-10 minutes later, my glass still sat there, all by it's lonesome, crying helplessly to be re-filled.  What did my glass do to deserve this??   In conclusion, I'm sticking to the frozen version of their pizza and not have to feel like an a$$hole because I don't tip the server because I feel they didn't deserve it. Side note for all you half a$$ed servers... TIP IS OPTIONAL. Know what it means as well "To Insure Proper Service"  comply and you shall be rewarded. Otherwise don't look at non tippers as a$$holes.  Thanks.

This is not the first bad experience I've had at this location but I can say that this will be my absolute last. I cannot believe how unorganized and lackluster the service is here, and in this particular instance that has caused me to finally write a review, how disgusting the sanitary standard is. I purchased a salad to go and while eating it discovered a 12 inch light brown/dark blonde hair in my mouth. I am so completely disgusted with this that I didn't even want to eat the remainder (majority) of my salad.  I've given this location several chances and opportunities to create a positive experience but every time has been consistently awful. I would never recommend anybody to this location. It is embarrassing that of the three restaurants available at this mall, this one can't manage to get their business together. I implore upper management to take a close look at the business and health standards being represented at the Beverly center location.

C. and I wanted to eat a quick dinner tonight before going to a movie at the Beverly Center 13 upstairs at the mall, but we weren't turned on by any of the options in the food mall. So we hoofed back downstairs to eat at the California Pizza Kitchen, which is usually an OK standby for somewhat healthy and well prepared chain restaurant or borderline fast food. We weren't entirely disappointed. I think they've changed the recipe for their Italian tomato and basil pizza, as I remember it having fresh tomato slices, more cheese, and no powdered cheese on top. This, while good, seemed a little more chainy. C.'s margherita, which is basically the same, only with thinner crust, was better. I'd get that next time. We both got Italian sodas, peach and cranberry, and they were fine. Not bad, but not as good as others I've been to.

Its a great location for lunch. The service is good. And  they have take out. I m not the biggest fan of their pizza, but I love their pasta, its amazing. I and my coworkers order for take out at least once a month. Everytime we place an order, they tell us it will be ready in 30 minutes, but everytime we go to get it, we wait additional 30 minutes to an hour. Its pretty annoying. Not once has it been ready on time. I would gave it 3 stars cause of the wait, but my love for their pasta, makes me give it 4 stars.
This place has great pizza and is a good deal for the price. Wait time is not too long either.

Ordered kids cheese pizza for my daughter tonight and the pizza had a dead cochroach in it!  When I called management they simply refunded the money.  When there is 1 roach, there are more!  I don't think I'd eat there at that location again, and the manager should have gone a little more out of their way when a guest finds a dead roach in their childs kids cheese pizza! I even took a picture of the pizza with the roach but cannot see where on Yelp to upload it.

i come here almost every week and the customer service here is amazing. i usually have my regulars: bbq salad, tostada pizza w/ thin crust, chinese chicken salad, guacamole & chips, etc. The manager, Ivan, he's great, always has a smile on his face, greets the customers and is always aware of whats going on the restaurant. The chefs in the back are awesome, always preparing the dishes in a perfect way & greeting me when i come to the bar :) love them

This is my 3rd yelp review. I ordered the wild caught mahi mahi, applied a $5 coupon, and paid for my pre Golden Globe take out with a gift card. The staff was plentiful, working their ass off, super attentive, and courteous, so I don't understand why this place  doesn't have a higher rating.

I used to really despise CPK and then we went there last night on a whim after a visit to Bed, Bath, and Beyond and I have to say...I'm pleasantly surprised! My boyfriend and I did valet ($6) in order to be close to BB &B without braving the holiday fanfare upstairs at the Beverly Center and since we were there and not too many choices, CPK seemed a good choice. We ordered THREE...yes THREE...pizzas: the chicken with onions and garlic, the white pizza sans bacon, and the tomato/basil/garlic pizza.  ALL were YUMMMY with three m's!! lol  And yes, not the world's best...the dough is well, bready...not NYC style crispy.  But with that being said, the bread is pretty DARN good!  We ate every last bite of all 2 pies between the two of us so that must say SOMEthing. :) Advice:  Call ahead with your order and then valet to pick it up.  If you valet and are there 15 mins or less it's FREEEEEEE!  (same goes for pick-ups at Chipotle and P.F. Changs...)

I like CPK....I have been to CPK so many times....I swayed between 3 and 4 stars because the food is by no means fantastic but I really like several items on the menu.  The pear and gorgonzola pizza is great...I love adding both pear and gorgonzola to salads, pizzas, and anything else I can find at the moment.  The hummus is pretty good although I would prefer to not have all those tomatoes on top messing the whole dish up.  The item that I like the most is the BBQ chicken salad but I get it without the BBQ and chicken (weird i know but hey, i am a vegetarian)....I love that they put jicama in it, it really spruces it up and it is a fun surprise!  Also, they have a pretty big menu and a lot of vegetarian selections.  Last night we also got the spinach dip which was good...just your standard fattening spinach dip with chips...we liked it! My fiance is uber-picky and he LOVES the Jamaican jerk pizza....personally the smell of that one make me want to hurl but he sure does love it.  I have been to like 6 or 7 CPKs throughout the LA area but I just happen to be at this one last night...the wait staff was quite accommodating and friendly..I was catching up with a friend and he didn't mind that we were there for a few hours....the prices are very affordable and the food is always the same....I like how you can walk in to a CPK (no matter which one) and its always the same....you know what to expect and I have never been disappointed.

I LOOOOOOOOOOOOOVE  CPK! This CPK is almost always crowded, but not crowded enough for a 30 minute wait. The food is always good when I go.  The mushroom pepperoni pizza and the grilled chicken caesar with a side of caesar salad are tied as my favorites.  The bread & butter is delicious especially when the plate is hot so it softens the butter.  The best drink that I've had there would be the peach iced tea. It is the best to drink when you're parched on a hot summer day.  As for dessert, you CAN NOT go wrong with the hot fudge brownie sundae. OMG, that is the best!! It is a fresh out-the-oven brownie topped with ice cream & your choice of whatever syrup you like.  The spinach & artichoke dip is pretty damn good. The chips are not too salty & the dip is pretty thich with spinach, but still good!  The sesame ginger chicken dumplings are good, but I wish they gave more than 4.
No different than any other CPK, but a little smaller... Park at the Jamba Juice across the street like all Beverly Centers adventures.  I still love the Thai Chrunch Salad.. can't get enough of it.

There are so many better places to eat in LA besides CPK, but should you find yourself either craving it or with someone from out of town who insists on going or you simply are exhausted, can't decide what to eat and CPK is right nearby, then let's hope this is the particular location for your CPK visit. Like McDonald's, the food is same at all locations, but the service at the Beverly Center location is awesome. Management runs the place like a military unit and everyone is super friendly. I was surprised, but actually found myself reflecting back and thinking, yeah, that was a solid eating experience. Service does make the food more enjoyable.

You cant realy complain about CPK. Its good food, cheap prices and a diverse menu from Pizza to salads, sandwiches to pastas... The moroccan chicken salad is to die for! My advice however is not to open the nutritional menu that they also hand you with the menus, because you wuld be amazed at how many calories are in the pizzas and salads!!!

Yeah, OK, CPK is a chain, but their food is generally well-prepared, the variety is good, and the prices are reasonable.  This particular one is pretty small, and it lacks the airy feel of the Pasadena location, but the food is still more than decent.  Biggest bugaboo is the frickin' traffic around the Beverly Center, but once in a while the wife & I schlep the girls over, and we have a nice dinner.  There's something for everybody, and portions are such that we usually end up bringing stuff home.  This is the kind of place I usually forget about when trying to decide where to go eat, darn...

Worst service ever and the food was gross. Pasta was dry and under cooked. Salad came after the main entrees. I asked for extra sauce for my dry under cooked pasta and it took them about 20 minutes to bring it out saying the kitchen is backed up. We didn't even get bread until the main dishes came out. Very disappointed.

i may not be cool enough to have hos in different area codes, but i can always count on CPK. the fact that it's a chain is the best part - it's always going to be consistently the same deliciousness no matter what city i'm in.  i like the la cienega location just because i can have a humongous lunch and then walk it off while i shop the bev center.  what do i order when i'm there? always the same thing for the past 8 years. 1. soup/salad combo: corn chowder soup + waldorf salad. 2. either the tostada pizza or the spicy chipotle chicken pizza. and while i wait for my food to come out, i butter my complimentary bread, douse it in some cholula sauce, and sip my captain & diet.  yum in my tum. one of my favorite restaurants of all freakin' time. when i lived in san diego, i must have eaten at the CPK by the ucsd campus at least once a week. when i moved to LA, the first thing i did was track down local CPKs.  this place is my heaven. random, i know. but different strokes for different folks. minus one star for consistently shitty service, weird seating arrangements, smelly restaurants and unnecessarily high prices.

I was very disappointed with the hostess I thought the hostess was discriminating against us because we were African Americans they seated  two other couples before us and when we were finally seated we were placed on the corner this occurred on December 26 2014 at 8:00 p.m. Ultimately; we enjoyed our meal but this experience with the hostess ruin the evening
Love this location. The service is always perfect and fast. My recommendation, try the 4 cheese ravioli.

I was just here this past weekend with my friend and OMG even though I have eaten here so many times, I must write a review about one of my favorite restaurants of all time!!!!  Kinda sad, that CPK would be it, but EVERYTHING always tastes so good here.  Been going to CPK ever since I was little and my mom and I would stop here right after a long day of shopping. So this past weekend we ordered the fried macaroni and cheese, white pizza (my first time trying it), and full bbq chicken chopped salad. It was all delicious. My friend and I basically finished everything except for a slice of pizza and some scraps here and there.  CPK, even though you're a franchise, you still serve one of the best stuff out there! It ain't a fancy spot, but you can definitely rely on this place to make your stomach happy :) Never a bad time here.  If you have any questions about food, feel free to ask me! I've tried almost everything on the menu!!!!!

Worst service at a CPK. We had a group of 9 and the wait was decently short. We each ordered our meals and chatted over drinks. We were never given or even offered bread and wasn't given any until we asked for it. My mom's order was still missing halfway into the meal and when we asked, we were told it was almost ready. 10 minutes later, it still hadn't arrived so we inquired about it again. We were then told it will be right out. My mom ended up eating off of everyone else's plates while waiting. Another 5-10 minutes later, the rest of us were already done with our meals so we asked for the order to be cancelled. Our server told us it was about to be brought out. We told her we were done with our dinner and that the order obviously wasn't placed at the same time as the others, but by her 15-20 minutes ago. She tried to make it seem like she couldn't cancel the order but we told her she should've told us it was never placed to begin with, instead of lying to us and then inputting the order when we were more than halfway through our meal. No sincere apology was given. We spoke with the manager, Apres, who was also rude and unapologetic. Had a "I don't care; don't want to be here" attitude. She just told us that it was removed from the bill. Very rude and unprofessional, especially in front of her own staff. Whatever happened to leading by example? Such poor customer service from a manager. The server ended up offering to give us the order to go for free but we declined; we weren't after a free meal - just good service and an apology when a mistake was made. Definitely will not be returning here.

I like their food, but the service at corporate resaurants always sucks. Why? Because they run their employees ragged and spread them way too thin in order to keep costs down. They also train them to look, act and serve like replicants from planet douchebag. This location was especially bad because of the neverending stream of shoppers coming down from the mall, stressing everyone out to no end. I feel like these kinds of places are for people who have never really eaten in a good restaurant before. Go to vintage enoteca on sunset instead, the prices are about the same, the environment is just much more welcoming and relaxed, and the service is far more attentive and genuine.
Was here over the weekend. Took at least 15 minutes to order. The good was late, the drinks never come and no fresh bread. Was very disappointed
Service is slow and food is overpriced. Portion size is okay. Obviously, the pizza is good. Also, the pasta dishes are good as well. Hell, even the salad is good.
Food is consistent and good, servers friendly and efficient.  The place is in dire need of a remodel though, and it stinks of mildew. Yuk!!

I read another review of CPK, and it's haunting me: Some guy said that CPK clearly switched up ingredients over the years and now it's not as good.  I've been coming here for 10 years and have only ever loved it.  The appetizers are bangin'.  The deserts are insane!  The pies are just the right size and there's a great selection so that you'll always have fun trying something new or going back to an old fav! The pear gargonzola pie - which I don't even know if it's on the menu anymore - its a homerun and I'm sure a slice will pass before my mind's eye in my dying moments on earth.  It doesn't matter if they still do have it - i love a place who switches it up and gives you more options.   I also love a place where you can sip cheap white wine and eat pizza at the same time.  Ayyy! classy guy over here.  It's starting to feel a little 80s/90s though in it's decor.  I wish they could do something to make it feel less like a chain.  And hey - knock it off with those ugly pizza box paintings - or get some real artists to do them.  They look schlocky and make me less hungry.   Red Velvet cake - 100% yes yes yes!!!  I just made icing in my pants thinking about this!

My family and I have been to this CPK location for many years. The service is usually fast and always friendly. Skip the sodas and other drinks so you can really taste the great food you're about to order. Order a nice glass of ice water with lemon instead. If you're really hungry, ask for the free warm bread with dipping oil, while you look over the menu with a huge selection! I suggest you order the Two in a Bowl soup and split a Chinese Chicken salad with your party. I really like the Fire-Roasted Chile Relleno and my wife almost always orders the Chicken Tequila Fettuccine. There is a thin crust pizza called Roasted Artichoke + Spinach that is so good too! For dessert, I'd skip the Butter Cake and go for the Tiramisu. What else can I say? For quality and value, CPK is just right!

It was my first time here and I sat at the bar because I was on my lunch break. My food came quick which was nice but no one ever  refilled my drink. I went through my whole meal and tried to get their attention but no one helped me again. The manager looked lost and he kept yelling at his employees In front of me. Super awkward. I was obviously done and looking for someone to give me my check. Finally Alex the bartender realized I looked pissed and came over with the check. I told him I was upset about my refill. He ended up Giving me a refill to go he thought his manager was taking care of me.  Alex is the only reason they're getting a 4.

Been to many CPK's all over So Cal; been to this particular one at Beverly Center many times in the past too and this is the first time I had a bad experience. The wait staff changed, I don't know if it is bad management or just turnover, but management was no where to be seen so that is not a good sign either. Last night...We waited 10-15 min. to be acknowledge by our server Katie (dyed her hair red). Very muted and stand off-ish. Asked for bread service...never came. I reminded her 15 min. later she said "sure" as if she is hearing the request for the first time. The Kung Pao Spaghetti was lacking in chicken pieces; usually there is a good amount, this is the first time there were only bits and pieces. I didn't complain because service was bad enough and just wanted to eat and get out. While eating another lady sat by herself and was waiting and waiting and waiting for her server, she sat at the table next to ours. She looked around and gave this exasperated look. I spoke to her and said we are having a bad experience too, waited 10 min to be acknowledged, and I am not leaving a tip. The lady said she already wasted 15 min of he lunch, she got up and walked out and told the hostess at the front what happened. On my way out I also told the hostess our serve Katie was horrible. Horrible horrible service from our server and the food was sub par, horrible all around CPK. I do not think I will ever go back to this CPK location. This location will end up out of business if you continue in this manner, no managers to be seen and no acknowledgment by staff and the food was sub par compared to other locations. Get your act together CPK beverly center! It's not difficult to provide good friendly service by people who want to be there and good food by following CPK standard menu preparation procedures.
The place used to be too noisy but this time was  very nice. The waitress was attentive and quinoa salad was very yummy.
Pretty consistent chain.  Food always taste the same across the board.  I love the mushroom pizza.  The service here is wonderful and you can go shopping right after so that's awesome :)

Worst CPK ever in the city of Los Angeles. Waiter kept bringing the wrong food and kept insisting I was wrong and she heard something else -__- don't tell me what I said. Took 45 mins just bring a salad. I mean what you got to do? Grow the lettuce first ? And the some the staff members had attitude. Not my fault you work there. Don't like it. Quit.

CPK is not exactly the most trendy LA restaurant but the menu has really been upgraded. I had a sufficiently filling caramelized peaches and chicken salad with a light vinaigrette dressing. Really really good. My wife got the spinach and artichoke pizza....crust was nice and thin and very tasty. My teen got the Kung Pao spaghetti with shrimp and loved every noodle of it. My oldest teen got the classic BBQ chicken pizza. I removed the cheese and nibbled on it and as with my last CPK visit it was exceptionally good. The service was great---my tweens thoug the server was a movie star because of his eye color (whatever)...but everybody in LA looks like this don't they?? Would definitely good back if no other quality food places were in the area.
Foods great like every cpk... Staff is so rude and impatient though at this specific location. Step it up... This ain't a fast food joint.

The only reason it's gets 2 stars is because the food was good. The service, on the other hand, was atrocious. Our appetizer plate along with the bread plate were still on the table when we finished our main course. The server visits were few and far in between. Will definitely never go back. Should have stuck with the Beverly Hills branch, where we normally go. That one offers much better service.

Horrible experience!! If I could give minus rating, I woudl give -5 stars. First, I received ice water in broken glass. When I asked for replacement, the wait staff did not believe me that glass was broken. He gave me attitude. Then, he never came back to take our order. When finally he did, we never received our food. I saw other tables getting their food which they came after us. Another service staff (much nicer guy) came to tell us that "computer crashed" therefore they needed to take our order again. How come computer crash deleted our order ONLY and no other tables?? After waiting for SOOOOO long, we got our burned pizza and salad. We were so hungry that we did not ask for unburn pizza. We just removed burn part and started to eat. When I was having second slice of pizza, I saw hair.... OH NO!!!.  We wanted to the manager to complain, but we realized that if the restaurant runs this way, what we should expect from manager. My boyfriend asked for check and left that restaurant to go to next door. The wait staff asked us if we wanted box for our pizza, we just said no thank you. I cannot believe how big chain restaurant can fall under average quality service and food.

Our server, Eddie, was really nice and attentive. The food was great and the restaurant was clean. Big open windows and a nice, upbeat, open atmosphere. The host was a little snobby but that wouldn't deter me from going again.

mlk day part 1: this is a 3 part story. i am still groggy like a bear out of hibernation. my throat is dry and all i got to drink is pepsi. i had weird drunk dreams as well. it started here at cpk of all places. my friend had a 100 dollar gift certificate to cpk. so this is how meatheads like us plan. we were gonna go to cpk and get drunk with that money then go out on the cheap. which didn't really work out. cpk had no hard liquor and trying to get drunk on been on a limited time was rough but we got a good buzz going. i've been to other cpks that had hard liquor though. our service was really good. maybe its cuz our server was from hawaii so he's just real chill. the pizza, we got the works and the sicilian and also humous. all very good.  this reminded me when i was real young and someone body would get their hands on a 20 dollar bill and we  would all get a crap load of chicken nuggets and split it. thats how we were doing it this night.  next up the club area!

It's not the world's greatest pizza in the world, but for the variety they offer and for the other items on the menu, it'll do when everyone needs to be appeased.  The desserts are good.  The best part is that you can find one almost anywhere in L.A. now.

Yuck.  I liked this place when I was young and thank god my taste buds have matured.  Nothing truly seems fresh and last time I ordered a salad my stomach immediately started hurting and I got food poisoning.

I love CPK. The environment is kid-friendly and their kids menus are really fun to draw. I like to order a  half chopped salad with no scallions or garbanzo beans. I also get a small barbeque chicken pizza. The salad is delicious and so is the pizza. Personally the BBQ chicken pizza is the best pizza on the menu. I recommend this fun and delicious restaurant!
it's westcoast style 'stylish' pizza...what can u say?? i like the tandori...but somehow i just have a hard time stomaching peanut butter based sauce on top of my pizza.

Wonderful service. I think when one receives excellent service the food tends to taste better or perhaps it was the fact that we drank so much wine. Maybe it was the wine, which was fantastic, Shiraz my friends this is the way to go. I'm giving it 4 stars not because of the food but because of the location. I'm not going to write so much about the food because since this is chain, the items and taste of the food on the menu are the same in each location.This CPK is located on the first floor of the Beverly Center. You can do what we did with my friends, drink some wine or beer, pick your poison ,and then head over to the shops in the Beverly Center. Shopping and people watching becomes a lot more fun @ the Beverly Center. Once your done with your shopping and your buzz has died down, just head down La Cienega to this little bar to continue the fun. The bar is about three shops down from the coffee bean. Drinks are cheap and the crowd is laid back. Parking at CPK is located inside the Beverly Centers structure, if you plan to spend more then two hours in the area expect to pay between $4-$5. Try the carne asada pizza and the chocolate souffle. Happy eating and drinking:)
The food is decent and predictable, but the service at this one is always good.  Everyone is friendly everytime I've been there.  Makes eating at a pretty okay chain restaurant worthwhile.

I've never worked in a restaurant but it seems like there are a few basic rules all restaurants should follow. 1. Put a friendly human in the host/hostess position and have them greet customers when they come in. 2. Don't tell customers there is a 10 minute wait when they can clearly see many empty tables. 3. Send a waiter to the table once customers are seated and take their order within a reasonable amount of time. 4. Clear empty tables. 5. Don't give food away. Guess which of the above we experienced? If you guessed all five, you are correct. I think the manager had his head up his ass. Due to the crap service, EVERYONE was getting some part of their meal comped. At the end of the meal they had the nerve to give us playing pieces to some promotional game - the catch being you could only play if you came back. Ah, yah. Good luck on that one.

Having not have dined at CPK in over 4 years, I was surprised to see the size of this place. This is the smallest cpk that I have been to. I also was reminded of why I haven't been back to this place. Not to say ti's a bad restaurant, because it isn't, but when it comes to pizza and italian food, there's tons of other places in the city to go to. I love nothing better than going to a hole in the wall to get my regular greasy pepperoni and mushroom pizza, served by some greasy, sweaty, unshaven, sweat stains soaking through his white shirt with his belly sticking out a foot in front of the rest of his body, guy named sal. But if you must go to a restaurant that is also a stand up place, I guess CPK is good. It's also good if you desire a pizza that is not something you see every day such as the Buffalo Chicken Pizza (at the time I wanted a pizza and buffalo wings, so I took out two birds with one stone). Don't expect it to be high end though, this place does lettuce wraps with iceberg lettuce... tsk tsk tsk.... the rule is red leafed, romaine or higher. I don't eat what I used to feed to my rabbits, or else I'd be munching on newspapers and green pellets right now. What can I say, this place has no soul, no personality, things that are pertinent to establishing a restaurant that emerges from a crowd of similars, imposters... And please guys, don't take your girlfriend here, it's just not classy to take someone on a date to a place with the word "pizza" in it, I mean why not take them to pizza hut then??

There were tons of flies flying around near the food to the point that it wasn't even possible to eat. I had to stop eating . The manager didn't  seem to care and acted like it wasn't a big deal. He ignored the issue and sarcastically offered a food replacement instead. I don't know but i think it' kind of a big deal when there's a fly outbreak around your food in a cpk restaurant. Yes, first time at cpk that i've been to that had tons of flies....
